summary: This is a letter from Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP, representing Deutsche Bank, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. It transmits a fourth production of documents in response to a grand jury subpoena dated July 11, 2019, concerning accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The letter asserts confidentiality and privilege protections for the produced materials.

persons.name: Parvin D. Moyne
persons.context: Attorney from Akin Gump who co-signed the letter transmitting Deutsche Bank's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to the grand jury subpoena concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: James J. Benjamin, Jr.
persons.context: Attorney from Akin Gump who co-signed the letter transmitting Deutsche Bank's document production to the U.S. Attorney's Office in response to the grand jury subpoena concerning Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose financial accounts are the subject of the grand jury subpoena to Deutsche Bank. The produced documents include account opening documentation for accounts associated with him.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP representing Deutsche Bank in the grand jury matter.
Moyne, as counsel for Deutsche Bank, is involved in producing documents related to Epstein's accounts in response to a subpoena.
Benjamin, as counsel for Deutsche Bank, is involved in producing documents related to Epstein's accounts in response to a subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued to Deutsche Bank
events.description: A grand jury subpoena was issued to Deutsche Bank, compelling the production of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Fourth Document Production to SDNY
events.description: Deutsche Bank, through its counsel Akin Gump, submitted its fourth rolling production of documents in response to the July 11 subpoena, including account opening documentation for Epstein-associated accounts.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank was under grand jury investigation in July 2019, compelled by subpoena to produce documents related to Jeffrey Epstein's accounts.
The document production included account opening documentation for accounts associated with Jeffrey Epstein (documents DB-SDNY-0001289 through 0001710).
The law firm Akin Gump Strauss Hauer & Feld LLP represented Deutsche Bank in this matter, with attorneys Parvin D. Moyne and James J. Benjamin, Jr. handling the correspondence.
The production was treated as confidential under Federal Rule of Criminal Procedure 6(e), and Deutsche Bank sought to protect the materials from public disclosure.
This was the fourth in a series of rolling productions by Deutsche Bank in response to the subpoena, with more expected.
